3.1 Projects

3.1.3 Creating new projects

Functional Developer includes a New Project wizard for creating new projects.

The New Project wizard asks questions about what you are going to develop, and then creates a new project configured to help you get working quickly. See "Creating a new project" on page 59.

You can also create a project if you have a Dylan Library Interchange Description (LID) file for it. LID files have a .LID extension. When you open a LID file in the development environment, it is converted into a project file and opened in a project window. (This process does not modify the original LID file on disk.) See "Project files and LID files" on page 80.

Getting Started with Functional Developer - 31 MAR 2000
